results.title: Goodbye Gutenberg
results.creator_credit: BBC, WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.) and Edward Goldwyn
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Printed work is our main method of storing, retrieving and transmitting information, but the tiny electronic pulses in computers today are about to change that. Electronic text means words being stored, displayed, restored or sent around the world. The changes this could cause are discussed. Presented by Anthony Smith.

results.title: The Planets
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Edward Goldwyn
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Outlines the research and development of NASA, the National Aeronautics and Space Administration in the USA over the 13 years from 1961-1974. The significant findings of space missions and the techniques used to analyse information are dealt with. Scientists and astronauts involved discuss space exploration, the origins of the planets and the solar system. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: The Ape that stood up
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Traces the evolution of man, and his split from the apes to the development of modern man. Shows archaeological discoveries which helped to revise our ideas about the human line of descent. Includes research done by Lewis & Mary Leakey. No other credits available.

results.title: You are old, Father William
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Describes what happens to our mind and bodies as we grow older. Recent research into the physiology. Biochemistry, and psychology of old age is discussed. The processes of aging are many and complex and work at different rates. Although science is far from able to increase the maximum life span of human being. More and more people can live longer in better physical and meal health.

results.title: Invasion of the virions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Investigates the different sorts of virions, where they come, and why they succeed in taking over so completely. Why they are so difficult to fight and how do the virions manage to hide away in the body only to re-emerge later.

results.title: What's wrong with the sun?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Looks at some of the observations which have caused a crisis in the study of our sun. Until recently it was thought to be a constant well-understood star. But now it is oscillating with frequent vibrations. This may mean a complete revision of our ideas about the inner temperature and composition of the sun and hence all other stars.

results.title: Uranium goes critical
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Richard Reisz
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”
Discusses the role of uranium in the world’s energy situation. Maintains that at the present rate of use, uranium fuel could be used up in 20 to 30 years. Deals with the safety aspects of using uranium as a source of energy and asks if we should be looking at alternative technologies instead.

results.title: Green machine (Plants)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Coverage of the life of a green plant. The work involved in the plant producing its own food is discussed as it the importance of this process to an overall understanding of ecology. Implications for the future with respect to harvesting energy and food with this process are also raised.

results.title: Children of Peru
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Michael Andrews
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Documents new agricultural methods and technological discoveries in Peru and the beneficial effects these might have on the health and nutrition of the children of Peru if implemented. Narrated by paul Vaughan. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.
